cyclone.name: MATTHEW
cyclone.current_location: about 55 mi NNE of Cabo Lucrecia, Cuba
cyclone.trajectory: Moving northwest through the Bahamas and expected to scrape the southeast Florida coast, then parallel the coastline north-northwestward.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: very near the southeast coast of Florida (between Palm Beach and Broward counties)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch north of Flagler/Volusia county line to Fernandina Beach; Tropical Storm Warning Chokoloskee to Golden Beach, Florida Keys Seven-Mile Bridge eastward and Florida Bay
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning North of Golden Beach to the Flagler/Volusia county line including Lake Okeechobee and all of southeastern, central and northwestern Bahamas
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire southeast Florida Atlantic coast, especially Broward and Palm Beach counties
weather_observation.wind: Hurricane-force winds possible; 34-kt wind probability 84% and 50-kt wind probability 56% at the port, with peak onset around Thursday evening.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Coastal inundation of 2–4 ft possible; 3–5 ft surge forecast just north of the port with large battering waves entering Port Everglades channel.
weather_observation.rainfall: 4–7 inches with locally higher totals up to 10 inches, producing flash-flood potential around the port and inland storage areas.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents, large breaking waves affecting harbor entrance; potential debris flow and temporary channel closure.
